content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice and simple.  :-)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple straightforward task for an interesting game.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: An introductory level puzzle showing the basics of walking through a grid and looking at neighbors, with the usual concern for the edges; test cases cover a variety of scenarios.

The tests "Many Mines", "Lot of Mines", and their validators do not show any numbers in the left column as they should. Your code uses grid[y].slice(x-1,x+2) which doesn't do as you intended when x is 0.
This is not what I expected when I saw "reverse", but it looks like a great easy puzzle.

Thanks. What did you expected with "reverse" ? time reverse minesweeper ? I can give me ideas for a next puzzle :)
Tell me if you have a better title, I'm not good in english. "Solved Minesweeper" maybe ?
It's my mistake, you code should work now
You right I'll fix this soon :)

Yep.

I'd like to see a cover photo added, and then I would approve.

To me reverse implies either taking a step backwards, or possibly assuming the other role (as the machine instead of the player). I wouldn't say the title is incorrect, it's just not the game I expected. But it's the perfect difficulty level for an easy puzzle. Would a clearer title indicate something about resetting, completing, or revealing the board? I'm not sure. Looked at a different way, it's setting an initial configuration after the mines have been planted. But titles don't have to be precise anyway. The more interesting things are what you can do with minesweeper. Solve it, obviously, as a solo game that already exists. For classic in/out, plant a certain number of mines to satisfy a partially completed board... but it's probably too difficult to ensure that there's only one solution. Determine all the spots where a mine must, could, and can't exist. Find a missing number given the rest of the board, e.g. if a spot is opened that does not contain a mine. Just some thoughts. I do like this one, as it's very straightforward.

Ooh, "Reverse Minesweeper" would actually be a super fun game! You're the machine, and you have to stump the player who is a flawless bot. The initial opening is provided. Then you have to plant the mines in a way that's consistent with that, and corner the bot player into a position where it can't be completely sure that the next move is safe. So you can totally cheat, in a way, but it has to be consistent with what's shown on the board.
Looks haaaard to solve it (and program it lol) :p
